src:
Partizan prokockao 89 bodova za dve i po sezone
Crno-beli bolje rezultate prave u Evropi nego na domaćoj sceni
01 Nov 2019 by Vujadin Tomković
Prošle su dve i po sezone od poslednje šampionske radosti u Humskoj. Teško da je iko očekivao takav pad Partizana nakon titule koju je osvojio u maju 2017. godine, kada je slavio u dramatičnom foto-finišu Superlige ispred Crvene zvezde.
U naredne dve sezone, kao i ovu koja još nije dobacila do polovine, Partizan se potpuno prosuo na domaćoj sceni. Ispada da je bolje prolazio na evropskoj, gde je uspeo u istom periodu da stigne do evropskog proleća, kao i da vodi veliku bitku, sa postojećim šansama, da ponovi ove jeseni isti uspeh. Jedino do grupa nije stigao prethodne takmičarske godine, kada mu se na poslednjoj stepenici isprečio Bešikštaš. Ostaje nekako neobjašnjivo kako to da Partizan bolje leže Jang Bojs, Astana, Malatija, Molde nego Vojvodina, Čukarički, Napredak, Radnički...
Kada se sve sabere za prethodne dve i po sezone, pokazuje se da je Partizan prokockao ukupno 89 bodova! Sa takvim učinkom, zaista, ne može se do titule. Barem ne na srpskoj elitnoj sceni gde i jedan kiks izaziva zabrinutost, a posle drugog se pali alarm. Posle trećeg se već razmišlja ili šuška o smeni trenera. Posle četvrtog je šampionska trka gotova. 
U prvoj sezoni nakon osvojene poslednje titule Partizan je uzeo 77 od mogućih 111 bodova (37 kola sa plej-ofom). Upisali su crno-beli 23 pobede, osam mečeva su završili nerešeno, a šest su izgubili. Tim iz Humske 1 je imao 12 bodova zaostatka za Zvezdom posle regularnog dela prvenstva, a nakon polovljena bodova i dodatnih sedam kola, bilo je minus 17 na kraju. 
Naredna godina je bila još gora. Jedna od najtežih u poslednjih 30 godina na crno-beloj strani Topčiderskog brda, čak je Partizan na kraju završio kao treći na tabeli. Od 111 mogućih bodova, tim koji su trenirali u sezoni Miroslav Đukić, Zoran Mirković i Savo Milošević, uzeo je 69 bodova. Dobio je 20 utakmica, devet je remizirao, a osam puta je izgubio. Imao je Partizan čak 30 bodova manje od Zvezde posle 30 kola, a na kraju, pošto su se bodovi delili na pola pred plej-of, okončao je sa minus 18.
I tekuća sezona vuče na te dve prethodne. Iako su svi oduševljeni kako Partizan igra na evropskoj sceni, gde je igrao ravnopravno i sa Mančester junajtedom u Humskoj, u „domaćici“ ne može da se sastavi. U četiri poslednja kola, doživeo je tri poraza. I već je prosuo 13 mogućih bodova i ima 10 zaostatka za Crvenom zvezdom.
Domaća liga postala je neobjašnjivo teška po Partizan. Ako za prethodnu sezonu stoji objašnjenje da su crno-beli imali slab tim, da su se promenila tri trenera, koja su imala svoje ideje i sa kojima je ekipa svaki put kretala ispočetka, ove jeseni je teško dokučiti šta to nije po volji igračima Parnog valjka, da mogu da se isprse na evropskom frontu, a da u istom sastavu ne mogu da slome ni Mladost u Lučanima, ni Čukarički na Banovom brdu...
Trener Savo Milošević smatra da nema dovoljno širok igrački kadar za jednake nivoe igre protiv Mančestera i Astane odnosno Lučana i Čukaričkog. Ako je to tačno, onda crno-bele čeka ozbiljan rez u igračkom kadru u zimskom prelaznom roku. Jasno je da u timu postoje nepopunjene rupe na pojedinim pozicijama, da pojedini igrači ne mogu da dobace do nivoa potrebnog za Partizan, za igru koju traži Milošević, ali i pored toga, negde nešto škripi kod Parnog valjka kada mu za gostovanja nije potreban pasoš. 
Šta god da je razlog, 89 prosutih bodova za dve i po sezone je rezultat debelo ispod renomea Partizana. Treću sezonu zaredom ispada da crno-beli već na početku novembra mogu da se oproste od borbe za titulu. Drugu godinu zaredom ne drže čak ni drugo mesto na tabeli. Negde nešto baš škripi...

text:
Partizan missed 89 points in two and a half seasons
Black and whites do better in Europe than on the domestic scene
01 Nov 2019 by Vujadin Tomkovic
Two and a half seasons have passed since the last championship joy in Humska. Hardly anyone would have expected such a fall for Partizan after the title he won in May 2017, when he celebrated in the dramatic Super Finals photo finish in front of Red Star.
Over the next two seasons, as well as one that has not yet gotten halfway through, Partizan has completely spilled on the domestic scene. It turns out that he did better in Europe, where he managed to reach the European spring in the same period, and to wage a great battle, with the existing chances, to repeat the same success this fall. Only the groups did not reach the previous competition year, when Besikštas was prevented at the last step. It remains unclear how Partizan is better placed by Young Boys, Astana, Malatia, Molde than Vojvodina, Cukaricki, Napredak, Radnicki ...
When it all comes together for the previous two and a half seasons, Partizan is shown to have missed a total of 89 points! With such an effect, indeed, one cannot get to the title. At least not in the Serbian elite scene, where one pixie is a cause for concern and an alarm goes off after another. After the third one is already thinking or rustling about a coach change. After the fourth, the championship race is over.
In the first season after winning the last title, Partizan took 77 of a possible 111 points (37 rounds with the playoffs). They registered 23 wins in black and white, eight matches ended in draw and six lost. The team from Humska 1 had 12 points behind the Stars after the regular part of the championship, and after half a point and an additional seven rounds, it was minus 17 in the end.
The next year was even worse. One of the toughest in the last 30 years on the black-and-white side of Topcider Hill, even Partizan eventually finished third in the standings. Of the 111 possible points, the team trained in the season by Miroslav Djukic, Zoran Mirkovic and Savo Milosevic took 69 points. He won 20 games, nine draws, and lost eight times. He had Partizan as much as 30 points less than Zvezda after 30 rounds, and in the end, as the points were split in half before the playoffs, he ended up with minus 18.
And the current season drags on those two previous ones. Although everyone is delighted with how Partizan plays on the European stage, where he played equally with Manchester United at Humska, he cannot make up in the 'housewife'. In his last four rounds, he suffered three defeats. And he has already spilled 13 possible points and is 10 behind the Red Star.
The home league has become inexplicably difficult for Partizan. If for the previous season it is explained that the Black and Whites had a weak team, that three coaches had changed, who had their own ideas and with whom the team moved from scratch each time, this fall it is difficult to see what is not to the liking of the Steam Roller players. , that they can crush on the European front without being able to break Mladost in Lučani or Čukaricki on Banovo brdo in the same composition ...
Coach Savo Milosevic believes that he does not have a wide enough staff for equal levels of play against Manchester and Astana and Lucan and Cukaricki. If this is true, then the black and white are waiting for a serious cut in the player frame in the winter deadline. It is clear that there are unfilled holes in certain positions in the team, that some players cannot get to the level required for Partizan for the game sought by Milosevic, but in addition, there is something squeaking about the Steam Roller somewhere when he does not need a passport for away games.
Whatever the reason, the 89 spill points for two and a half seasons is a result well below Partizan's reputation. For the third season in a row, black and whites can say goodbye to the title fight in early November. For the second year in a row, they do not even hold the second place on the table. Something just squeaks somewhere ...
